channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: Marvels of Starved Rock
item.description: In northern Illinois, a lovely state park draws crowds to its riverside cliffs and forest canyons.

item.title: Toasting Oktoberfest
item.description: These festive tributes to Bavarian tradition put the oompah into fall.

item.title: Duluth 101
item.description: Here's everything you need to know about visiting this lively port town on Lake Superior.

item.title: Michigan's Pictured Rocks
item.description: There's a lot of scenery crammed into one stretch of Lake Superior in Michigan's Upper Peninsula.

item.title: Afoot in the Porkies
item.description: On the Upper Peninsula, a splendid wilderness remains unchanged in the Porkies.

item.title: Still fighting the Civil War
item.description: Across the Upper Midwest, Civil War battle reenactments turn history into flesh and blood.

item.title: So many festivals, so little fall
item.description: The season is short, so go on a power trip and catch two or three festivals each weekend. Here's where to go.

item.title: 10 great day trips from the Twin Cities
item.description: Within an hour's drive, you can cruise Lake Minnetonka, stroll on the St. Croix or climb a historic bluff.

item.title: 10 great day trips from Madison
item.description: See the circus, visit Swiss towns or ride a rail trail: There's fun in every direction.

item.title: 10 great day trips around Milwaukee
item.description: Ride trolleys, see lighthouses, spot birds and hike past mansions.

item.title: Following the tall ships
item.description: Sloops and schooners still sail on Lake Michigan and Lake Superior.

item.title: Free days in Minnesota and Michigan state parks
item.description: On the second weekend of June, everyone is invited for a day of fishing, hiking and trail riding.
